workflow.name: Recreate Instagram reels with Gemini 2.0 analysis & minimax video generation
workflow.description:
This n8n template demonstrates how to automatically download an Instagram Reel, analyze its content using AI video understanding, and regenerate a similar video using AI video generation models. The workflow creates AI-powered variations of existing video content while maintaining visual consistency and style from the original source material.‚Äã‚Äã

Use cases are many: Content creators can produce multiple variations of trending reels, social media managers can recreate viral content with brand-specific modifications, or marketers can generate similar videos without copyright concerns while maintaining the original's visual appeal and storytelling structure.‚Äã

## Good to know
Video generation typically takes 2-5 minutes per video. The workflow includes automatic polling to check completion status.‚Äã

Minimax Video-01 generates videos up to 6 seconds long at 720p resolution and 25fps with cinematic camera movements.‚Äã

Gemini 2.0 Flash processes video at 1 frame per second (approximately 300 tokens per second of video), making it ideal for detailed video analysis.‚Äã

The workflow includes retry logic for failed API requests to ensure reliability.‚Äã

Ensure you have sufficient API credits in your Replicate account before running high-volume workflows.‚Äã

## How it works
The workflow begins when a user submits an Instagram Reel URL through the chat trigger interface.‚Äã

The RapidAPI Instagram Reels Downloader fetches the video metadata and download URL from Instagram.‚Äã

Downloaded video data is formatted and validated to ensure successful retrieval before proceeding.‚Äã

The video file is uploaded to Google's Gemini 2.0 Flash model via their File API for processing.‚Äã‚Äã

Gemini 2.0 Flash analyzes the video frame-by-frame, generating a comprehensive description covering visuals, audio, movements, lighting, camera angles, and transitions.‚Äã‚Äã

The AI-generated description is formatted as a continuous text prompt (lowercase, no punctuation) optimized for video generation models.‚Äã

This detailed prompt is sent to Replicate's Minimax Video-01 model to generate a new video based on the analysis.‚Äã

The workflow polls the Replicate API every 2 minutes to check generation status, automatically looping until completion.‚Äã

Once generation succeeds, the final AI-generated video is downloaded and ready for use or further processing.‚Äã

## How to use
The chat trigger node accepts Instagram Reel URLs as input, but you can replace this with webhooks, forms, or scheduled triggers depending on your automation needs.‚Äã

Replace all placeholder API keys in the workflow before activation (RapidAPI, Google AI Studio, and Replicate).‚Äã

Test with short Instagram Reels first (under 30 seconds) to optimize processing time and token usage.‚Äã

The workflow automatically handles null checks and retries if the initial download fails, ensuring robust execution.‚Äã

Requirements
RapidAPI account for Instagram Reels Downloader API (handles video extraction from Instagram)‚Äã

Google AI Studio API key with Gemini 2.0 Flash access enabled (for advanced video analysis)‚Äã‚Äã

Replicate API account with sufficient credits for Minimax Video-01 model access (for AI video generation)‚Äã

Active n8n instance (self-hosted or cloud) to run the workflow automation‚Äã

## Customising this workflow
This AI video recreation workflow can be adapted for numerous creative and business applications. Try extending it to generate multiple style variations from one input video, add branding overlays or watermarks before final output, or integrate with cloud storage (Google Drive, Dropbox) for automated archiving. You can also chain this workflow with content scheduling tools to automatically post generated videos to social media platforms, or combine it with analytics nodes to track which AI-generated variations perform best with your audience.

nodes.name: Checks if the video generation is complete

parameters.content:
## üéØ STEP 1: Input Trigger

**What happens here:**
This chat trigger node waits for a user to send a message (the Instagram Reel URL).

**How it works:**
- User sends Instagram Reel URL via chat
- The URL is captured in `{{ $json.chatInput }}`
- Workflow execution begins

**No configuration needed** - webhook ID is auto-generated

## üì• STEP 2: Download Instagram Reel

**What happens here:**
Calls RapidAPI to fetch the Instagram Reel metadata and download URL.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_RAPIDAPI_KEY_HERE` with your actual RapidAPI key

**Headers to check:**
- `x-rapidapi-host`: Already configured
- `x-rapidapi-key`: ‚ö†Ô∏è ADD YOUR KEY HERE

**Output:**
Returns JSON with video URL in `data.medias[0].url`

## üîÑ STEP 3: Format Data

**What happens here:**
Extracts the video URL from the API response and stores it in a clean variable.

**Technical detail:**
- Takes `$json.data.medias[0].url`
- Assigns it to `Instagram Reel` variable
- Makes data easier to reference later

**No configuration needed** - this is data transformation only

## ‚úÖ STEP 4: Validation Check

**What happens here:**
Checks if the video URL was successfully retrieved.

**Logic:**
- IF URL = null ‚Üí Retry the download (loops back)
- IF URL exists ‚Üí Continue to download

**Why this matters:**
Sometimes API calls fail. This ensures we have valid data before proceeding.

**No configuration needed**

## üé• STEP 5: Download Video File

**What happens here:**
Actually downloads the Instagram Reel video file as binary data.

**Technical detail:**
- Uses the URL from previous step
- Downloads complete video file
- Stores as binary data for upload

**Output format:** Binary video data (MP4)

**No configuration needed**

## ‚òÅÔ∏è STEP 6: Upload to Google AI

**What happens here:**
Uploads the video to Google's Gemini model for analysis.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_GOOGLE_API_KEY_HERE` in the URL parameter

**Headers (pre-configured):**
- Upload commands for Google's File API
- Content-Type set to video/mp4

**Output:**
Google returns a `file.uri` that identifies your uploaded video

## ü§ñ STEP 7: AI Video Analysis

**What happens here:**
Sends the uploaded video to Gemini 2.0 Flash to analyze and describe every detail.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_GOOGLE_API_KEY_HERE` in the URL parameter

**What the AI does:**
- Analyzes video frame-by-frame
- Describes visuals, audio, movements, lighting
- Outputs a detailed text description
- Format: continuous lowercase text (no punctuation)

**This description becomes the prompt for video generation!**

## üé¨ STEP 8: Generate New Video

**What happens here:**
Uses Replicate's Minimax Video-01 model to create a new video based on the AI analysis.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_REPLICATE_API_KEY_HERE` in Authorization header

**How it works:**
- Takes the Gemini description as prompt
- Sends to Minimax video generation model
- Returns a prediction ID (not the video yet!)

**Note:** Video generation is asynchronous - we need to check status

## ‚è∏Ô∏è STEP 9: Wait Period

**What happens here:**
Pauses workflow execution for 2 minutes.

**Why we wait:**
- Video generation takes time (typically 2-5 minutes)
- We give the model time to process
- Then we check if it's complete

**Adjustable:**
Change the `amount` parameter if videos consistently take longer/shorter

**No API keys needed**

## üîç STEP 10: Check Status

**What happens here:**
Queries Replicate API to see if video generation is complete.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_REPLICATE_API_KEY_HERE` in Authorization header

**Technical detail:**
- Uses prediction ID from Step 8
- Checks generation status
- Returns: "succeeded", "processing", or "failed"

**Next:** Decision node checks the status

## ‚úÖ STEP 11: Status Decision

**What happens here:**
Checks if video generation succeeded.

**Logic flow:**
- ‚úÖ If status = "succeeded" ‚Üí Fetch the video
- ‚ùå If still processing ‚Üí Loop back to Wait node

**Why loop:**
Some videos take longer than 2 minutes. This ensures we don't miss the result.

**No configuration needed**

## üéâ STEP 12: Download Generated Video

**What happens here:**
Fetches the final AI-generated video file.

**Configuration required:**
‚úèÔ∏è Replace `YOUR_REPLICATE_API_KEY_HERE` in Authorization header

**Output:**
- Binary video file (MP4)
- Ready for download or further processing

**Success!** Your AI-regenerated video is complete.

---

üí° **Pro Tip:** You can add nodes here to:
- Upload to cloud storage
- Send via email/webhook
- Post to social media

## üîÅ Wait Loop Node

**What happens here:**
This is where the workflow waits if video generation is still processing.

**Connected from:**
The "false" branch of Step 11 decision node

**Loops back to:**
Step 10 (Status check)

**This creates a polling mechanism** that keeps checking until the video is ready.

## üé¨ Trending Instagram Reel URL to AI Video Generator

**What this workflow does:**
This automation takes an Instagram Reel URL, downloads it, analyzes the video content using AI, and regenerates a similar video using AI video generation.

**Perfect for:** Content creators, social media managers, and anyone wanting to create variations of existing video content.

---

### üìã Setup Requirements:

**1. RapidAPI Key** (for Instagram downloads)
- Sign up at https://rapidapi.com
- Subscribe to "Instagram Reels Downloader API"
- Copy your API key

**2. Google AI Studio API Key** (for Gemini video analysis)
- Go to https://aistudio.google.com/apikey
- Create a new API key
- Enable Gemini API access

**3. Replicate API Key** (for video generation)
- Sign up at https://replicate.com
- Go to Account Settings ‚Üí API Tokens
- Create a new token

---

### üîß Configuration Steps:

1. **Replace ALL instances** of the following placeholders:
   - `YOUR_RAPIDAPI_KEY_HERE` ‚Üí Your RapidAPI key
   - `YOUR_GOOGLE_API_KEY_HERE` ‚Üí Your Google AI Studio key (appears twice)
   - `YOUR_REPLICATE_API_KEY_HERE` ‚Üí Your Replicate key (appears 3 times)

2. **Activate the workflow** in n8n

3. **Test with an Instagram Reel URL**

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes:
- Video generation can take 2-5 minutes
- Ensure you have credits in your Replicate account
- The workflow includes retry logic for failed requests
- Webhook IDs will be auto-generated when you save

main.node: Checks if the video generation is complete

user.name: Aditya Malur
user.bio: I design AI-powered automation systems that transform how businesses run sales, marketing, and operations. By connecting workflows and data intelligently, I help teams scale smarter reducing manual effort, improving decision-making, and driving predictable growth. My focus is on building lightweight, adaptive systems that make organizations more efficient and future-ready.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
